title: The Palantir of Westernesse
data:
| (   The Palantir of Westernesse   *(No tile)* |                                                                                                                                                                   |
| --------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Base item                                     | [crystal ball](/wiki/Crystal_ball "Crystal ball")                                                                                                                 |
|                                               |                                                                                                                                                                   |
| Affiliation                                   | - [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic")
- [Elf (role)](/wiki/Elf_\(role\) "Elf (role)")
- [intelligent](/wiki/Intelligent_artifacts "Intelligent artifacts")         |
|                                               |                                                                                                                                                                   |
| When carried                                  | * [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration")
* [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage")
* [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy") |
| When applied                                  | - [selective object detection](/wiki/Crystal_ball "Crystal ball")                                                                                                 |
| When invoked                                  | * [taming](/wiki/Taming "Taming")                                                                                                                                 |
|                                               |                                                                                                                                                                   |
| Base price                                    | 8000 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                                                                                                                |
| Weight                                        | [150](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                                                                                                                      |

**The Palantir of Westernesse** was the [Elf](/wiki/Elf_\(role\) "Elf (role)") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") that previously appeared in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It served as the prize for completing the [Elf quest](/wiki/Elf_quest "Elf quest") and defeating the [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis"), the [Goblin King](/wiki/Goblin_King "Goblin King"). It was [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") for [wishing](/wiki/Wishing "Wishing") purposes, and its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") was a [crystal ball](/wiki/Crystal_ball "Crystal ball").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 History](#History)

- [3 Origin](#Origin)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 NetHack Plus/SLASH 6](#NetHack_Plus.2FSLASH_6)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [5 References](#References)

## Description

When carried, the Palantir of Westernesse granted [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration"), [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy"), and [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage"). When [invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked"), it [tamed](/wiki/Taming "Taming") nearby creatures.

## History

The Palantir of Westernesse was introduced in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0"), and last appeared in [NetHack 3.2.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.2.3 "NetHack 3.2.3") - it was rendered [defunct](/wiki/Defunct "Defunct") along with the Elf role in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0"), which introduced the ability to choose a starting race, including [the elf](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)"). The role itself was given a spiritual successor in the [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger"), whose [quest branch](/wiki/Ranger_quest "Ranger quest") employs a somewhat similar structure and uses the exact same layout for the goal level, though [the quest artifact](/wiki/The_Longbow_of_Diana "The Longbow of Diana") and [the nemesis guarding it](/wiki/Scorpius "Scorpius") are much different.

The data for the Palantir can still be found within artilist.h in the code of NetHack from version 3.3.0 on.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Palantír](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palant%C3%ADr "wikipedia:Palantír")***

A **palantír** (/ˈpælənˌtɪər/; pl. palantíri) is a magical artifact from the setting of [J. R. R. Tolkien](/wiki/J._R._R._Tolkien "J. R. R. Tolkien")'s Middle-earth novels. It is an indestructible ball of crystal, used for communicating and viewing past and future events in other parts of Arda. The palantíri were made by the Elves of Valinor in the First Age - by the time of *The Lord of the Rings*, only a few remained in existence.

Various major characters make use of palantíri, and a major recurring theme is that users had to "possess great strength of will and of mind" to direct the stone's gaze to its full capability. Others would find the stones unreliable, since it was unclear whether the events shown were from the past or future - users with sufficient power could take advantage of this if they chose to.

Palantíri are the basis for [Elvenkings](/wiki/Elvenking "Elvenking") in *NetHack* generating with a crystal ball, which has a 1⁄50 chance of occurring. Elves are also the only starting race that can *naturally* reach an [Intelligence](/wiki/Intelligence "Intelligence") of 20, which allows crystal balls to be [applied](/wiki/Applied "Applied") without any chance of failure.

## Variants

Most variants still retain the Palantir of Westernesse in some manner, and a few of them opt to retool it.

### NetHack Plus/SLASH 6

In [NetHack Plus](/wiki/NetHack_Plus "NetHack Plus"), the Palantir of Westernesse was made lawful to reflect the Elf role being lawful instead of chaotic. [SLASH 6](/wiki/SLASH_6 "SLASH 6") retained this while making the Elf role open to all alignments. Their successor [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") did not retain the role or its artifact in versions based on 3.3.0 and later.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") retools the old Elf quest as the [Elvish Racial Quest](/wiki/Elvish_Racial_Quest "Elvish Racial Quest"), where elven [Nobles](/wiki/Noble "Noble"), [Priests](/wiki/Priest "Priest"), Rangers, and [Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") face the [Necromancer](/wiki/Necromancer_\(Quest_Nemesis\) "Necromancer (Quest Nemesis)") for the Palantir of Westernesse. The Palantir remains a chaotic, elf-favoring intelligent crystal ball - when carried, it grants x-ray vision, telepathy, [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning"), and [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"). Invoking the artifact can tame nearby monsters.

### SlashTHEM

In older versions of [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), the [Elph](/wiki/Elph "Elph") role was a retool of the old Elf role, and the Palantir of Westernesse served as the quest artifact.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [artilist.h in NetHack 3.3.0, line 158](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.3.0/artilist.h#line158 "Source:NetHack 3.3.0/artilist.h")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [include/artilist.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 186](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/artilist.h#L186)

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

[![This article is unlikely to require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/58/Noversion.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article is unlikely to require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

The Palantir of Westernesse

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
(   The Palantir of Westernesse   (No tile)
Base item crystal ball
Affiliation
  • chaotic
  • Elf (role)
  • intelligent
When carried
  • regeneration
  • half spell damage
  • telepathy
When applied
  • selective object detection
When invoked
  • taming
Base price 8000 zm
Weight 150

The Palantir of Westernesse was the Elf quest artifact that previously appeared in NetHack. It served as the prize for completing the Elf quest and defeating the quest nemesis, the Goblin King. It was chaotic for wishing purposes, and its base item was a crystal ball.

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 History
  • 3 Origin
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 NetHack Plus/SLASH 6
    • 4.2 dNetHack
    • 4.3 SlashTHEM
  • 5 References

Description

When carried, the Palantir of Westernesse granted regeneration, telepathy, and half spell damage. When invoked, it tamed nearby creatures.

History

The Palantir of Westernesse was introduced in NetHack 3.1.0, and last appeared in NetHack 3.2.3 - it was rendered defunct along with the Elf role in NetHack 3.3.0, which introduced the ability to choose a starting race, including the elf. The role itself was given a spiritual successor in the Ranger, whose quest branch employs a somewhat similar structure and uses the exact same layout for the goal level, though the quest artifact and the nemesis guarding it are much different.

The data for the Palantir can still be found within artilist.h in the code of NetHack from version 3.3.0 on.[1][2]

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Palantír

A palantír (/ˈpælənˌtɪər/; pl. palantíri) is a magical artifact from the setting of J. R. R. Tolkien's Middle-earth novels. It is an indestructible ball of crystal, used for communicating and viewing past and future events in other parts of Arda. The palantíri were made by the Elves of Valinor in the First Age - by the time of The Lord of the Rings, only a few remained in existence.

Various major characters make use of palantíri, and a major recurring theme is that users had to "possess great strength of will and of mind" to direct the stone's gaze to its full capability. Others would find the stones unreliable, since it was unclear whether the events shown were from the past or future - users with sufficient power could take advantage of this if they chose to.

Palantíri are the basis for Elvenkings in NetHack generating with a crystal ball, which has a 1⁄50 chance of occurring. Elves are also the only starting race that can naturally reach an Intelligence of 20, which allows crystal balls to be applied without any chance of failure.

Variants

Most variants still retain the Palantir of Westernesse in some manner, and a few of them opt to retool it.

NetHack Plus/SLASH 6

In NetHack Plus, the Palantir of Westernesse was made lawful to reflect the Elf role being lawful instead of chaotic. SLASH 6 retained this while making the Elf role open to all alignments. Their successor SLASH'EM did not retain the role or its artifact in versions based on 3.3.0 and later.

dNetHack

dNetHack retools the old Elf quest as the Elvish Racial Quest, where elven Nobles, Priests, Rangers, and Wizards face the Necromancer for the Palantir of Westernesse. The Palantir remains a chaotic, elf-favoring intelligent crystal ball - when carried, it grants x-ray vision, telepathy, warning, and reflection. Invoking the artifact can tame nearby monsters.

SlashTHEM

In older versions of SlashTHEM, the Elph role was a retool of the old Elf role, and the Palantir of Westernesse served as the quest artifact.

References

  1. ↑ artilist.h in NetHack 3.3.0, line 158
  2. ↑ include/artilist.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 186

The Palantir remains a chaotic, elf-favoring intelligent crystal ball - when carried, it grants x-ray vision, telepathy, [[warning]], and [[reflection]].
